org.commonreality.time

Interface IClock

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IAuthoritativeClock
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAuthoritativeClock, BasicClock, BasicClock.BasicAuthoritativeClock, NetworkedClock, NetworkedClock.NetworkedAuthoritativeClock, OwnedClock, OwnedClock.OwnedAuthoritativeClock, RealtimeClock, WrappedClock, WrappedClock.WrappedAuthority

    public interface IClock
    Clock interface that permits notifications of changes or time triggers.
    Author:
    harrison

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Optional<IAuthoritativeClock> getAuthority()
      Most clock instances are strictly passive, however some clock instances need to be controlled, allowing the caller to set the time to specific values.
      double getTime()
      the current time according to this clock
      CompletableFuture<Double> waitForChange()
      Return a future representing the future change of the clock from its value at the time of calling.
      CompletableFuture<Double> waitForTime(double triggerTime)
      Return a future representing when this clock reaches or passes the trigger time.

    • Method Detail

      • getTime

        double getTime()
        the current time according to this clock
        Returns:

      • getAuthority

        Optional<IAuthoritativeClock> getAuthority()
        Most clock instances are strictly passive, however some clock instances need to be controlled, allowing the caller to set the time to specific values. The authoritative clock (if available) makes that possible.
        Returns:

      • waitForChange

        CompletableFuture<Double> waitForChange()
        Return a future representing the future change of the clock from its value at the time of calling. Callers may use this synchronously CompletableFuture.get() or with a listener e.g. CompletableFuture.thenAccept(java.util.function.Consumer)
        Returns:

      • waitForTime

        CompletableFuture<Double> waitForTime(double triggerTime)
        Return a future representing when this clock reaches or passes the trigger time. No guarantee is made that this will be fired at the trigger time. It ultimately depends upon the underlying implementation. Callers may use this synchronously CompletableFuture.get() or with a listener e.g. CompletableFuture.thenAccept(java.util.function.Consumer)
        Parameters:
        triggerTime -
        Returns:
